titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the General Photographs Collection PHOTOS.001

editionstmt.p: This version was derived from NP 1 Guide General Photo Collection.doc

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2012-03-29T15:33-0400

physdesc.extent: (12 boxes, 2 oversized boxes, 2 boxes of special material)

did.abstract: The General Photograph Collection is an assemblage of photographs collected by or separated from Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive collections. Photographs depict events and people related to labor and/or leftist movements.

custodhist.head: Provenance
custodhist.p: Unlike other Tamiment/Wagner photograph collections, these images do not come from just one individual or organizational donor, but from myriad different sources, and have been merged to form an artificial collection. It was created (and is still being added to) to serve as a "home" for useful images that do not fit into the scope of Tamiment's regular archival collections. Provenance is unknown in many cases. Other images are drawn from many different sources. These include photographs that have been separated from Tamiment/Wagner papers and manuscript collections because they are not related to the specific subjects of the collections, but are nonetheless relevant to Tamiment/Wagner subject areas. They also include publicity photos, book illustrations and other published materials such as postcards and cartoons. The latter are not available for reproduction, but are rather meant to serve as reference images.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p:
Ability to publish varies because of copyright considerations (many of the images are simply reproductions from books); many of the images may be used for reference purposes only. Permission to publish materials must be obtained in writing from the:
Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives
Elmer Holmes Bobst Library
70 Washington Square South
New York, NY 10012
Phone: (212) 998-2630
Fax: (212) 995-4225
E-mail: erika.gottfried@nyu.edu

bioghist.head: Historical/Biographical Note
bioghist.p: This is an expanding artificial collection which began life as a photographic subseries of the Tamiment Library's vertical file collection, holding images separated from the Library's core archival and manuscript collections, and from other sources. With the organization and development of the Library's photograph collections, it was renamed the Tamiment Library / Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives General Photograph Collection, and was assigned the collection number NP1, the first of the Library's more than 100 photographic collections. Apart from the material transferred from the Library's vertical files, the General Photograph Collection holds photographic images that are not part of or do not fit into the scope of the Library's other photographic collections. Images continue to be added to the collection from various sources, including the Library's archival and manuscript collections.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: Arrangement is by subject, in alphabetical order. The number of individual items in each subject category varies widely-with some folders containing as many as fifty images, but many more holding just one image. Includes a wide range of images on radicalism and the trade union movement in the United States and Europe. Approximately one half of the images are portraits of individuals including Eugene Debs, Morris Hillquit, Rose Schneiderman, Karl Kautsky, Algernon Lee, James Hudson Maurer, Rose Pastor Stokes and Norman Thomas. The rest of the collection includes a wide (if sometimes idiosyncratic) variety of images, including strikes, demonstrations, Socialist Party and other radical left organizations' events and celebrations, workers summer resorts, women and minority workers, sweatshops. Materials include original photographs and photoreproductions of engravings, drawings and cartoons, reproductions from books, pamphlets, and periodicals.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The files are grouped into 1 series.
Folders are arranged alphabetically by subject in the finding aid; within the collection itself they are arranged numerically.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p:
Published citations should take the following form:
Identification of item, date; Collection name; Collection number; box number; folder number;
Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives
Elmer Holmes Bobst Library
70 Washington Square South
New York, NY 10012, New York University Libraries.
